alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 14 at 1:04PM MST until December 14 at 1:30PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MST FOR CENTRAL LARAMIE COUNTY... At 103 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 9 miles south of Chugwater to 12 miles northeast of Whitaker to Hillsdale to near Carpenter, and was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall will affect Highway 85 between mile markers 30 and 40, as well as Interstate 80 between mile markers 375 and 380. Locations impacted include... Hillsdale. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
